description: This creamy tortellini soup is a quick weeknight meal that the whole family will adore. With just a few ingredients, it’s ready in 30 minutes and bursting with flavor. Try this comforting dish tonight!
instructions: In a large pot, bring the broth to a boil over medium heat.
Add the tortellini and cook according to package instructions, usually about 3-5 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream, garlic, and spinach, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
tips: For perfect results, ensure the broth is boiling before adding the tortellini. Avoid overcooking the tortellini to maintain their texture.

structured_content.content: This creamy tortellini soup is a delightful dish that combines rich flavors and comforting textures, making it a perfect choice for busy weeknights. It's quick to prepare and sure to please everyone at the table.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Chop the spinach and mince the garlic while the broth heats up.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the steps to cook the tortellini and combine with cream and spinach.
Finishing Touches:
Adjust seasoning and serve hot with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese if desired.

upload.context: Cooking process of creamy tortellini soup.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook tortellini just until they float for perfect texture.
  • Avoid boiling the soup after adding cream to prevent curdling.
  • Visual cue: The soup should be creamy and the spinach wilted.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container and reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This soup is a staple at our family dinners, and sharing it with loved ones makes it even more special. It's a dish that brings comfort and joy!
Consider adding herbs like basil or thyme for extra flavor, or toss in some cooked chicken for added protein.
Serve with crusty bread or a side salad for a complete meal. A glass of white wine pairs beautifully with this dish.
For a gluten-free option, use gluten-free tortellini. You can also make it vegan by substituting the cream with coconut milk and using vegetable broth.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For a richer flavor, sauté the garlic in olive oil before adding the broth.
  • Use homemade broth for maximum flavor.
  • Timing is key; add spinach at the end to keep it vibrant.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Enjoy making this creamy tortellini soup and watch it become a beloved dish in your home. Cooking should be fun and rewarding!
